results.title: Angel of vengeance = Ms.45
results.creator_credit: Abel Ferrara, Navaron Films and Rochelle Films
results.brief_description: Abel Ferrara’s (‘Bad Lieutenant’, ‘King of New York’, ‘Driller Killer’) foray into the revenge fantasy genre is an often unnerving film which owes a lot to Roman Polanski’s disturbing tale of sexual terror, ‘Repulsion’. Set in the rough garment district of New York, ‘Angel of Vengeance’ follows the gradual descent into madness of Thana (Zoe Tamerlis), a mute seamstress who snaps after she is raped twice in one day. Her reaction to it plays like a strange form of liberation, as the once timid seamstress proceeds to off some of the more sleazier male citizens of New York city. Ferrara sprinkles this unusual and stylish low budget film with dark comic moments, eccentric characters (like Thana’s weird landlady played by Editta Sherman), and its slow motion climax is a beautiful and surreal piece of filmmaking. Cast includes Albert Sinkys, Darlene Stuto, Helen McGara, Nike Zachmanoglou.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Abel Ferrara, Navaron Films and Rochelle Films

results.title: Honey, I shrunk the kids
results.creator_credit: Joe Johnston, Penney Finkelman Cox and Buena Vista Pictures
results.brief_description: A non-stop comedy adventure starring Rick Moranis as a preoccupied inventor who has created an electro-magnetic shrinking machine that is accidentally activated and shrinks his children to a minuscule size. After they are caught in the garbage and thrown outside, a visually innovative action packed adventure ensues as the children journey through their backyard and encounter attacking insects, a runaway lawnmower, and swooping bees along the way. A fun and heartwarming family film it is also preceded by a Roger Rabbit short adventure involving Baby Herman and a little medical mayhem in “Tummy Trouble”. Cast also includes Matt Frewer, Marcia Strassman, Kristine Sutherland, Thomas Brown, Jared Rushton.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos, Jill Bilcock, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos, Jill Bilcock, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
description_for_label:

The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

results.title: Here's looking at you, Warner Bros.
results.creator_credit: Robert Guenette, Warner Bros Pictures and Wolper Organisation
results.brief_description: This feature length documentary celebrates 90 years of moviemaking history at Warner Bros in Hollywood. An entertaining chronicle of the studio’s history unfolds using choice moments from classic Warner films, interviews with artists and technicians, early screentests by Lana Turner, Orson Welles, Marlon Brando and Paul Newman, bloopers by Ronald Reagan and James Cagney and historical behind-the-scenes footage. Narrated by Clint Eastwood, Barbra Streisand, Goldie Hawn, Steven Spielberg and Chevy Chase.

results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Martin Gates, Carrington Productions and Martin Gates Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Hans Christian Anderson’s fairy tale, this is a story of kidnapping, magic and the heroic adventure of a young girl, Ellie, to thwart the evil Snow Queen who plots to turn the world to ice. After her brother is kidnapped by the Snow Queen to help her build a mirror to deflect the sun and freeze the planet, the courageous Ellie begins a journey with a reluctant bird named Peep. With a little help from magic she sets out to rescue her brother and defeat the Snow Queen. Released by Warner Brothers Family Entertainment this is an engaging story of adventure and the classic triumph of good over evil.

results.title: The Malta story
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: RAF camera reconnaissance pilot Peter Ross (Alec Guinness) is trapped on the island of Malta when his plane is destroyed enroute to Egypt in a bombing raid. While in Malta, Ross discovers that Italy is planning to invade, but the mission is thwarted as Allied control prevents the attack. With the Allied presence in place, Peter begins the dangerous task of tracing an enemy convoy carrying supplies to the German Army in North Africa, a mission that is fraught with danger, as communication to the Allied forces will alert the enemy to Peter’s position. Cast includes Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel, Muriel Pavlow and Flora Robson.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee: Crocodile Dundee II
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Hoyts, Paramount Pictures and Rimfire Films
results.brief_description: This double set features Australia’s highest grossing comedy film, ‘Crocodile Dundee’, and its significantly less successful sequel. ‘Crocodile Dundee’ (Producer: John Cornell, Director: Peter Faiman) A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. ‘Crocodile Dundee II’ (Producers: John Cornell, Jane Scott, Director: John Cornell) begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend, who he managed to secure in the first film. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them. Cast includes Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon, Mark Blum and David Gulpilil.

results.title: Night on earth
results.brief_description: This film by the talented independent director, Jim Jarmusch, is a collection of five vignettes each taking place in the confines of a taxi ride. Covering one night on earth, the stories occur simultaneously in five different cities and five different time zones: Los Angeles, New York City, Paris, London and Helsinki. Highlights include Roberto Benigni as the Roman taxi driver who recounts his past sexual exploits to a priest who is dying of a heart-attack in the back seat. In the New York scene a novice East German taxi driver (Armin Mueller-Stahl) has trouble with the foot pedals and his passenger ends up driving himself to Brooklyn. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Rosie Perez, Giancarlo Esposito, Winona Ryder, Beatrice Dalle.

results.title: Leo Tolstoy's Anna Karenina
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rose, Bruce Davey and ICON
results.brief_description: This adaptation of the Leo Tolstoy masterpiece, “Anna Karenin”, is noted for its stunning cinematography of the foggy Russian landscape. The screenplay is a faithful but abridged version of the novel set in 1880s Russia. The heroine, Anna (Sophie Marceau), is not happy in her marriage to the staid Karenin (James Fox), despite the joy she finds in their son. When she meets Count Vronsky (Sean Bean) in Moscow, where she goes to sort out the marriage problems of her brother, her life is turned upside-down. Their passionate affair causes her to lose her standing in society, being an unfaithful woman, to lose her son and eventually to lose the happiness she so desperately craved. The story is a tragic reminder of the downfall of a woman who dares to rebel against the rules of society. This affair is paralleled by the romance between Levin (Alfred Molina), the narrator of the story who is said to represent Tolstoy, and the young Kitty (Mia Kirshner), who had been in love with Vronsky until Anna captured his attentions. In English with occasional Russian dialogue subtitled in English.

results.title: Basketball diaries
results.creator_credit: Scott Kalvert, Liz Heller and Island Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘The Basketball Diaries’ is a horrowing growing-up story based on the true-life exploits of poet and musician Jim Carroll. Jim begins as a high-school basketball star at a Catholic high school where he experiments with drugs and is physically abused by his teachers. When his best friend dies of leukemia, Jim’s life suddenly becomes much more than adolescent angst, with him making the dark descent into the hell of heroin addiction and hustling. Jim’s poetry is the only thing he has left when he is found, literally on the street, by a tough ex-junkie, who undertakes his rehabilitation. Cast include: Leonardo Di Caprio, Bruno Kirby, Juliette Lewis and Ernie Hudson.
